title: Beauty and The Beast spoof video stars Lord Voldemort | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 551 shares Strolling into the castle with wand held aloft she finds her father trapped in a cell, much like the original. However, things take a shocking turn when non-other than the Dark Lord himself appears. Happy times: Taking the trailer from Disney's forthcoming blockbuster, which stars Emma as Belle, the video wizard has replaced her love-interest with non other than Lord Voldemort Thanks to some clever editing, the spoof trailer manages to ape the official Beauty and The Beast trailer almost perfectly. As Belle and Voldemort, AKA Tom Riddle, negotiate the high points and low points of the classic Disney tale, the laughs come thick and fast. Pictured with his faithful companions Cogsworth, Mrs. Potts and Lumiere, Voldemort is encouraged to pursue Belle, and the pair are picture in a series of hilarious loved-up scenes. He's a beast... In the video, created comedy YouTubers PistolShrimps, the classic Disney fairy tale is re-written so that Belle is a witch and her beast is non other than the Dark Lord Video wizardry: Thanks to some clever editing, the spoof trailer manages to ape the official Beauty and The Beast trailer almost perfectly Could he have his happy ending? Ralph Fiennes' evil character is portrayed as the haunted beast who has his heart mended by Belle Thanks to some sly editing replacing frames and snippets of the trailer with moments from the Harry Potter series, Lord Voldemort faces off against Luke Evans' Gaston as he fights for Belle. The trailer ends with the iconic moment where one of the roses petals falls from the stem, as Voldemort declares, 'I can not live forever', to the sound of a tinkling piano. The spoof comes as the release date of the live-action adaptation of the classic Disney film, starring Emma and Dan, draws closer. He's your man: Thanks to some sly editing the pair appear together in nearly every scene of the original trailer A new take: The spoof comes as the release date of the live-action adaptation of the classic Disney film, starring Emma and Dan, draws closer Talking about the much anticipated movie, Emma admitted to Entertainment Weekly that she wanted to do the original justice, but also make Belle more realistic and relatable to modern times. She revealed: 'We tried to tweak things to make her more proactive. A bit less carried along by the story, and a bit more in charge of — and in control of — her own destiny.' Also starring Ewan McGregor, Emma Thompson, Sir Ian McKellan, Stanley Tucci, and Kevin Kline, the film is due to hit cinemas on March 17 in the UK. A big hitter?
